newsitem.title: INDIA: India Colour not to merge with Clariant.
newsitem.headline: India Colour not to merge with Clariant.

text.p: Colour-Chem Ltd, a subsidiary of Clariant AG, will not merge with Clariant's other Indian subsidiary Clariant India Ltd in the near future, Colour-Chem chairman B. Hofmann said in the company's 1996/97 annual report.
"The transfer of Hoechst AG's shareholding of 50.1 percent in Colour-Chem on September 30, 1997, will make it a second subsidiary of Clariant AG in India," Hofmann told shareholders.

"A merger of the two subsidiaries in this country is not in the immediate offing -- on account of a conflict of interest posed by the textile dyes business which Colour-Chem is in the process of exiting," Hofmann said.
Colour-Chem will, however, benefit in many ways from being associated with the new Clariant organisation, he said.

"From being a relatively small constituent of a multi-product global conglomerate (Hoechst AG), it will become a sizeable player in the new integrated speciality chemicals global set-up, representing a region that is fast gaining recognition for its growth potential," he said.
The change in India follows Hoechst AG's decision last month to combine its speciality chemicals business with Clariant AG, a former subsidiary of Sandoz AG.

The new integrated Clariant AG which came into existence on July 1, 1997, is expected to be the largest speciality chemicals company in the world with a turnover of over 8.5 billion Swiss francs, Hofmann said.
